text:
Message 1877 of 4024
As I said, please quit telling me what I’m saying instead of just listening to what I am saying.
I do not get that behavior. It is incredibly frustrating and counterproductive to our conversation.
I apologize for my choice of words. I get triggered when you do that so often, but it’s no excuse.
Please accept my apologies . I really need help in dealing with that sort of behavior. It’s hard.
Sent:03/05/2024 at 01:38 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 03/05/2024 at 01:54 PM)
Subject:Re: Dr Brown Today
Message 1878 of 4024
Now that we have that out of our system. And we have triggered each other. Is there a way that you might find a few minutes prior to Dr. Brown or
we can have a peaceful conversation, confirm our reconciliation, and discuss how we want to move forward in the best interest of the children?
I do want to make it clear again, that despite my frustration, I need to do a better job and I sincerely apologize for saying something that upset you.
That was inappropriate regardless of what’s going on.
